name: peace-of-amiens
description: Brief peace treaty between Britain and France ending the French Revolutionary Wars temporarily before hostilities resumed.

name: code-napoleon
description: French civil code established by Napoleon that influenced legal systems worldwide and remains the basis of French law.

name: fultons-steamboat
description: Robert Fulton's Clermont made the first commercially successful steamboat voyage on the Hudson River.

name: venezuela-declares-independence
description: Venezuela became the first South American nation to declare independence from Spain, beginning the continent's liberation.

name: burning-of-moscow
description: Moscow was set ablaze as Napoleon's army occupied the city, denying French forces shelter and contributing to their defeat.

name: treaty-of-ghent
description: Peace treaty ending the War of 1812 between the United States and Britain, restoring pre-war boundaries.

name: chile-independence
description: Chile formally declared independence from Spain after the Battle of Maip√∫ secured liberation from colonial rule.

name: first-atlantic-steamship-crossing
description: The SS Savannah became the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean, though it used sails for most of the voyage.

name: mexican-independence
description: Mexico gained independence from Spain after an eleven-year war, establishing the First Mexican Empire.

name: brazil-independence
description: Prince Pedro declared Brazil's independence from Portugal, becoming Emperor Pedro I of the new Brazilian Empire.

name: uruguay-independence
description: Uruguay gained independence as a buffer state between Argentina and Brazil following British-mediated negotiations.

name: catholic-emancipation-act
description: British law that allowed Catholics to sit in Parliament and hold most public offices for the first time since the 1600s.

name: july-revolution-france
description: Three days of revolution in Paris overthrew King Charles X and established the constitutional July Monarchy.

name: belgium-independence
description: Belgium separated from the Netherlands following a revolution, becoming an independent constitutional monarchy.

name: reform-act-1832
description: British electoral reform that expanded voting rights to middle-class men and eliminated rotten boroughs.

name: factory-act-uk
description: British law that limited child labor in textile factories and created the first factory inspectors.

name: zollverein-formed
description: German customs union that eliminated trade barriers between German states, paving the way for unification.

name: texas-revolution
description: American settlers in Texas rebelled against Mexico, leading to the famous Battle of the Alamo and Texas independence.

name: first-anesthesia-surgery
description: Crawford Long performed the first surgery using ether anesthesia, though his work wasn't published until later.

name: first-telegraph-message
description: Samuel Morse sent 'What hath God wrought' from Washington to Baltimore, demonstrating the electric telegraph.

name: texas-annexed
description: Texas joined the United States as the 28th state after nine years as an independent republic.

name: oregon-treaty
description: Treaty between the US and Britain establishing the 49th parallel as the border in the Pacific Northwest.

name: ether-anesthesia-demonstrated
description: William Morton publicly demonstrated ether anesthesia at Massachusetts General Hospital, revolutionizing surgery.

name: liberia-independence
description: Liberia declared independence, becoming Africa's first republic, founded by freed American slaves.

name: california-gold-rush
description: Discovery of gold at Sutter's Mill sparked a massive migration to California, transforming the American West.

name: revolutions-of-1848
description: Wave of revolutionary uprisings swept across Europe demanding liberal reforms and national independence.

name: compromise-of-1850
description: Series of bills that temporarily eased sectional tensions over slavery, including a stronger Fugitive Slave Act.

name: great-exhibition-opens
description: World's first international exhibition of manufactured products opened in London's Crystal Palace.

name: second-french-empire
description: Louis-Napoleon Bonaparte proclaimed himself Emperor Napoleon III, establishing the Second French Empire.

name: commodore-perry-returns-japan
description: Perry returned with a larger fleet and signed the Treaty of Kanagawa, opening Japan to American trade.

name: florence-nightingale-crimea
description: Nightingale revolutionized military nursing during the Crimean War, dramatically reducing death rates.

name: bessemer-process
description: Henry Bessemer patented an inexpensive method for mass-producing steel, enabling the industrial age.

name: dred-scott-decision
description: Supreme Court ruled that African Americans could not be citizens and Congress couldn't ban slavery in territories.

name: miracles-at-lourdes
description: Bernadette Soubirous reported visions of the Virgin Mary in Lourdes, France, creating a major pilgrimage site.

name: first-transatlantic-cable
description: First telegraph cable across the Atlantic connected Europe and North America, though it failed after weeks.

name: lincoln-douglas-debates
description: Series of seven debates between Abraham Lincoln and Stephen Douglas focused on slavery and popular sovereignty.

name: john-browns-raid
description: Abolitionist John Brown led a failed raid on Harpers Ferry armory, hoping to spark a slave rebellion.

name: south-carolina-secedes
description: South Carolina became the first state to secede from the Union following Lincoln's election.

name: emancipation-russian-serfs
description: Tsar Alexander II freed millions of Russian serfs, the largest emancipation in history at the time.

name: homestead-act
description: US law gave settlers 160 acres of public land if they farmed it for five years, spurring western expansion.

name: bismarck-becomes-minister-president
description: Otto von Bismarck became Prussia's Minister-President, beginning his campaign to unify Germany through 'blood and iron.'

name: alaska-purchase
description: United States purchased Alaska from Russia for $7.2 million, initially mocked as 'Seward's Folly.'

name: impeachment-andrew-johnson
description: President Andrew Johnson was impeached by the House but acquitted by the Senate by one vote.

name: rome-becomes-italian-capital
description: Italian forces captured Rome from the Papal States, completing Italian unification with Rome as capital.

name: standard-oil-founded
description: John D. Rockefeller founded Standard Oil, which became the largest and most powerful oil monopoly.

name: german-empire-proclaimed
description: Wilhelm I was proclaimed German Emperor at Versailles, unifying Germany under Prussian leadership.

name: treaty-of-frankfurt
description: Peace treaty ending the Franco-Prussian War, with France ceding Alsace-Lorraine to Germany.

name: yellowstone-national-park
description: World's first national park was established in Wyoming, setting a precedent for conservation worldwide.

name: monets-impression-sunrise
description: Claude Monet painted this iconic work that gave the Impressionist movement its name.

name: centennial-exhibition
description: First official World's Fair in the US celebrated America's 100th anniversary in Philadelphia.

name: serbia-independence
description: Serbia declared independence from the Ottoman Empire, later recognized at the Congress of Berlin.

name: congress-of-berlin
description: Major powers redrew Balkan boundaries after the Russo-Turkish War, creating new independent states.

name: bulgaria-independence
description: Bulgaria gained autonomy from the Ottoman Empire following the Congress of Berlin.

name: dual-alliance
description: Germany and Austria-Hungary formed a defensive alliance that would later expand into the Triple Alliance.

name: tuskegee-institute-founded
description: Booker T. Washington founded Tuskegee Institute in Alabama to provide vocational education for African Americans.

name: chinese-exclusion-act
description: First US law to ban immigration based on nationality, prohibiting Chinese laborers for ten years.

name: british-occupation-egypt
description: Britain occupied Egypt to protect the Suez Canal, beginning decades of colonial control.

name: orient-express-first-run
description: The famous luxury train made its first journey from Paris toward Constantinople.

name: haymarket-affair
description: Bombing at a Chicago labor rally killed police and workers, leading to controversial trials of anarchists.

name: dawes-act
description: US law divided tribal lands into individual allotments, undermining Native American communal land ownership.

name: brazil-abolishes-slavery
description: Brazil became the last country in the Americas to abolish slavery with the Golden Law.

name: brazil-becomes-republic
description: Military coup overthrew Emperor Pedro II, establishing the First Brazilian Republic.

name: oklahoma-land-rush
description: Thousands of settlers raced to claim land in the first Oklahoma Land Run, opening former Indian Territory.

name: sherman-antitrust-act
description: First US federal law prohibiting monopolistic business practices and promoting fair competition.

name: bismarck-dismissed
description: Kaiser Wilhelm II dismissed Chancellor Bismarck, ending the Iron Chancellor's 28-year dominance of German politics.

name: ellis-island-opens
description: Ellis Island began processing immigrants, eventually welcoming over 12 million people to America.

name: worlds-columbian-exposition
description: Chicago hosted a world's fair celebrating Columbus, featuring the first Ferris wheel and White City.

name: panic-of-1893
description: Severe economic depression caused by railroad overbuilding and bank failures, lasting four years.

name: dreyfus-affair
description: French Jewish officer Alfred Dreyfus was falsely convicted of treason, exposing deep antisemitism in France.

name: treaty-of-shimonoseki
description: Treaty ending the First Sino-Japanese War, with China ceding Taiwan and recognizing Korean independence.

name: klondike-gold-rush
description: Discovery of gold in Canada's Yukon Territory sparked a massive migration of prospectors to the region.

name: plessy-v-ferguson
description: Supreme Court upheld 'separate but equal' doctrine, legalizing racial segregation for nearly 60 years.

name: ethiopian-victory-adwa
description: Ethiopia defeated Italian forces at Adwa, preserving independence and becoming a symbol of African resistance.

name: queen-victorias-diamond-jubilee
description: Massive celebrations marked Queen Victoria's 60 years on the throne, showcasing British imperial power.

name: us-annexes-hawaii
description: United States annexed the Republic of Hawaii as a territory following the overthrow of the monarchy.

name: fashoda-incident
description: British and French forces confronted each other in Sudan, nearly causing war before France withdrew.

name: panama-independence
description: Panama declared independence from Colombia with US support, enabling construction of the Panama Canal.

name: norway-independence-sweden
description: Norway peacefully dissolved its union with Sweden, becoming an independent constitutional monarchy.

name: algeciras-conference
description: International conference resolved the First Moroccan Crisis, affirming French influence in Morocco.

name: tunguska-event
description: Massive explosion over Siberia flattened 2,000 square kilometers of forest, likely caused by a meteor.

name: young-turk-revolution
description: Military officers forced the Ottoman sultan to restore the constitution and parliament.

name: austria-annexes-bosnia
description: Austria-Hungary formally annexed Bosnia-Herzegovina, inflaming Serbian nationalism and Balkan tensions.

name: model-t-production-begins
description: Ford's affordable Model T automobile made car ownership accessible to middle-class Americans.

name: japan-annexes-korea
description: Japan formally annexed Korea, beginning 35 years of colonial rule on the peninsula.

name: union-of-south-africa
description: Four British colonies merged to form the Union of South Africa as a self-governing dominion.

name: portugal-becomes-republic
description: Republican revolution overthrew the Portuguese monarchy, establishing the First Portuguese Republic.

name: federal-reserve-created
description: US Congress established the Federal Reserve System as the nation's central bank.

name: sykes-picot-agreement
description: Secret British-French agreement divided Ottoman territories in the Middle East into spheres of influence.

name: balfour-declaration
description: British statement supporting a Jewish homeland in Palestine, shaping Middle East politics for generations.

name: february-revolution-russia
description: Popular uprising forced Tsar Nicholas II to abdicate, ending 300 years of Romanov rule in Russia.

name: zimmermann-telegram
description: German offer of alliance to Mexico against the US was intercepted, helping push America into World War I.

name: fourteen-points
description: President Wilson outlined principles for peace including self-determination and a League of Nations.

name: german-revolution-1918
description: Revolution ended the German Empire and Kaiser Wilhelm II fled, establishing the Weimar Republic.

name: czechoslovakia-founded
description: New nation emerged from the collapse of Austria-Hungary, uniting Czech and Slovak peoples.

name: munich-beer-hall-putsch
description: Hitler's failed coup attempt in Munich led to his imprisonment, where he wrote Mein Kampf.

name: time-magazine-first-issue
description: Henry Luce launched Time, America's first weekly news magazine, revolutionizing journalism.

name: scopes-trial
description: Tennessee teacher John Scopes was tried for teaching evolution, becoming a national spectacle.

name: first-five-year-plan-ussr
description: Stalin launched rapid industrialization of the Soviet Union through centralized economic planning.

name: vatican-city-created
description: Lateran Treaty established Vatican City as an independent state, ending the Roman Question.

name: black-thursday
description: Stock market crash on October 24 began the Great Depression, the worst economic crisis in modern history.

name: smoot-hawley-tariff
description: US tariff act raised import duties dramatically, worsening the Great Depression through trade wars.

name: japan-invades-manchuria
description: Japan seized Manchuria from China, creating puppet state Manchukuo and defying the League of Nations.

name: first-nazi-concentration-camps
description: Dachau and other camps opened to imprison political opponents shortly after Hitler took power.

name: us-leaves-gold-standard
description: Roosevelt took the US off the gold standard domestically to combat deflation during the Depression.

name: night-of-long-knives
description: Hitler purged SA leadership and political rivals, consolidating Nazi power through targeted murders.

name: nuremberg-laws
description: Nazi racial laws stripped German Jews of citizenship and banned marriages between Jews and non-Jews.

name: italy-invades-ethiopia
description: Mussolini's forces invaded Ethiopia, using poison gas and exposing League of Nations weakness.

name: rhineland-remilitarized
description: Germany violated Versailles by sending troops into the demilitarized Rhineland without allied response.

name: rape-of-nanking
description: Japanese forces massacred hundreds of thousands of Chinese civilians and soldiers in Nanking.

name: germany-absorbs-austria
description: Germany annexed Austria in the Anschluss, uniting the two German-speaking nations under Nazi rule.

name: nazi-soviet-pact
description: Germany and Soviet Union signed non-aggression pact with secret protocols dividing Eastern Europe.

name: blitz-begins
description: Germany began sustained bombing campaign against British cities, killing over 40,000 civilians.

name: final-solution-begins
description: Nazi Germany began systematic genocide of European Jews through death camps and mass shootings.

name: internment-japanese-americans
description: US government forcibly relocated 120,000 Japanese Americans to internment camps during World War II.

name: casablanca-conference
description: Roosevelt and Churchill met in Morocco, demanding unconditional surrender from Axis powers.

name: bretton-woods-conference
description: Allied nations established postwar monetary system with fixed exchange rates and the IMF and World Bank.

name: san-francisco-conference-un
description: Representatives from 50 nations signed the UN Charter, establishing the United Nations.

name: first-eniac-computer
description: ENIAC, the first general-purpose electronic computer, was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania.

name: nuremberg-verdicts
description: International tribunal convicted Nazi leaders of war crimes, establishing precedent for international law.

name: truman-doctrine
description: US policy to contain communism by supporting nations resisting Soviet pressure, starting with Greece and Turkey.

name: cia-created
description: National Security Act established the Central Intelligence Agency as America's foreign intelligence service.

name: who-founded
description: World Health Organization was established as a UN agency to coordinate international public health.

name: korean-peninsula-divided
description: Separate governments were established in North and South Korea along the 38th parallel.

name: indonesia-independence
description: Netherlands recognized Indonesian independence after four years of armed struggle against colonial rule.

name: germany-divided
description: Federal Republic of Germany and German Democratic Republic were established, dividing Germany until 1990.

name: inchon-landing
description: MacArthur's amphibious landing at Inchon turned the tide of the Korean War against North Korean forces.

name: treaty-of-paris-ecsc
description: Six European nations created the European Coal and Steel Community, precursor to the European Union.

name: anzus-treaty
description: Security alliance between Australia, New Zealand, and the United States for Pacific defense.

name: egyptian-revolution-1952
description: Military coup led by Nasser overthrew King Farouk, ending British influence in Egypt.

name: dien-bien-phu-falls
description: Vietnamese forces defeated French army at Dien Bien Phu, ending French colonial rule in Indochina.

name: montgomery-bus-boycott
description: Rosa Parks' arrest sparked a year-long boycott that desegregated Montgomery buses and launched MLK's career.

name: austrian-state-treaty
description: Treaty ended Allied occupation and restored Austrian sovereignty as a permanently neutral state.

name: de-stalinization-speech
description: Khrushchev denounced Stalin's cult of personality and crimes in a secret speech that shocked communists worldwide.

name: morocco-independence
description: Morocco gained independence from France and Spain, restoring the monarchy under Mohammed V.

name: tunisia-independence
description: Tunisia gained independence from France after nationalist movement led by Habib Bourguiba.

name: little-rock-nine
description: Nine Black students integrated Little Rock Central High School under federal troop protection.

name: fifth-french-republic
description: New constitution gave de Gaulle strong presidential powers, establishing France's current government.

name: nasa-founded
description: US created NASA to lead the space race against the Soviet Union after Sputnik's launch.

name: alaska-hawaii-statehood
description: Alaska and Hawaii became the 49th and 50th US states, completing continental expansion.

name: dalai-lama-flees-tibet
description: Dalai Lama escaped to India after failed Tibetan uprising against Chinese rule, establishing exile government.

name: antarctic-treaty
description: Twelve nations agreed to preserve Antarctica for peaceful scientific research, banning military activity.

name: u2-incident
description: Soviet Union shot down American U-2 spy plane, capturing pilot Gary Powers and escalating Cold War tensions.

name: freedom-riders
description: Civil rights activists rode buses through the South to challenge segregation, facing violent attacks.

name: peace-corps-founded
description: Kennedy established the Peace Corps to send American volunteers to developing countries.

name: algeria-independence
description: Algeria gained independence from France after eight years of brutal war, ending 132 years of colonial rule.

name: second-vatican-council
description: Pope John XXIII convened council that modernized Catholic Church, allowing Mass in local languages.

name: limited-test-ban-treaty
description: US, UK, and USSR agreed to ban nuclear weapons tests in the atmosphere, underwater, and in space.

name: gulf-of-tonkin-resolution
description: Congress authorized military force in Vietnam after reported attacks on US ships, escalating the war.

name: mandela-sentenced
description: Nelson Mandela was sentenced to life imprisonment for sabotage against South Africa's apartheid government.

name: khrushchev-ousted
description: Soviet leadership removed Khrushchev from power, replacing him with Brezhnev.

name: selma-to-montgomery-march
description: Civil rights marches for voting rights faced violent opposition, leading to the Voting Rights Act.

name: immigration-act-1965
description: US law abolished national origin quotas, transforming American immigration toward Asia and Latin America.

name: miranda-v-arizona
description: Supreme Court required police to inform suspects of their rights before interrogation.

name: paris-may-events
description: Student protests and general strikes nearly toppled the French government in massive social upheaval.

name: fair-housing-act
description: US law banned discrimination in housing sales and rentals based on race, religion, or national origin.

name: nixon-doctrine
description: Nixon declared allies must take primary responsibility for their own defense while US provided support.

name: british-troops-northern-ireland
description: British Army deployed to Northern Ireland amid escalating sectarian violence beginning the Troubles.

name: kent-state-shootings
description: Ohio National Guard killed four students during anti-Vietnam War protests at Kent State University.

name: epa-created
description: Nixon established the Environmental Protection Agency to consolidate federal environmental regulation.

name: black-september
description: Jordan expelled Palestinian militants after hijackings and civil war threatened the monarchy.

name: intel-microprocessor
description: Intel released the 4004, the first commercial microprocessor chip, revolutionizing computing.

name: pentagon-papers
description: Leaked documents revealed government deception about the Vietnam War, published by the New York Times.

name: end-of-bretton-woods
description: Nixon ended dollar convertibility to gold, collapsing the fixed exchange rate system.

name: bloody-sunday-ireland
description: British soldiers killed 14 unarmed civil rights protesters in Derry, escalating the Northern Ireland conflict.

name: watergate-break-in
description: Burglars connected to Nixon's reelection campaign broke into Democratic headquarters, starting the scandal.

name: club-of-rome-report
description: Limits to Growth report warned that economic growth would deplete Earth's resources within a century.

name: oil-crisis-1973
description: Arab oil embargo quadrupled oil prices, causing economic crisis and gas shortages in Western nations.

name: opec-embargo
description: Arab OPEC members cut oil production and embargoed the US and allies supporting Israel in the Yom Kippur War.

name: uk-joins-eec
description: United Kingdom joined the European Economic Community after two earlier applications were vetoed by France.

name: carnation-revolution
description: Peaceful military coup ended decades of dictatorship in Portugal, named for flowers placed in gun barrels.

name: cyprus-divided
description: Turkish invasion following Greek coup divided Cyprus into Greek and Turkish zones that remain today.

name: microsoft-founded
description: Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft to develop software for personal computers.

name: spanish-democracy-transition
description: Franco's death enabled Spain's transition to democracy under King Juan Carlos.

name: djibouti-independence
description: Djibouti gained independence from France, becoming the last French colony in Africa to achieve sovereignty.

name: vietnam-invades-cambodia
description: Vietnamese forces invaded Cambodia, ending the Khmer Rouge genocide and installing a new government.

name: sandinista-revolution
description: Sandinista rebels overthrew the Somoza dictatorship in Nicaragua, establishing a socialist government.

name: zimbabwe-independence
description: Rhodesia became independent Zimbabwe under Robert Mugabe, ending white minority rule.

name: sdi-announced
description: Reagan proposed the Strategic Defense Initiative to protect against nuclear missiles, dubbed Star Wars.

name: gorbachev-becomes-leader
description: Mikhail Gorbachev became Soviet leader, initiating reforms that would ultimately end the Cold War.

name: glasnost-perestroika
description: Gorbachev introduced policies of openness and restructuring to reform the Soviet system.

name: first-ozone-hole-discovered
description: Scientists discovered severe ozone depletion over Antarctica, leading to global action on CFCs.

name: people-power-revolution
description: Peaceful mass protests overthrew dictator Ferdinand Marcos, restoring democracy in the Philippines.

name: us-bombs-libya
description: Reagan ordered airstrikes on Libya in retaliation for terrorism, targeting Gaddafi directly.

name: black-monday-1987
description: Stock markets crashed worldwide on October 19, with the Dow falling 22% in a single day.

name: inf-treaty
description: US and USSR agreed to eliminate intermediate-range nuclear missiles, a major arms control achievement.

name: soviet-withdrawal-afghanistan
description: Soviet Union began withdrawing troops from Afghanistan after nine years of costly war.

name: pan-am-flight-103
description: Bombing destroyed Pan Am flight over Lockerbie, Scotland, killing 270 people in a terrorist attack.

name: velvet-revolution
description: Peaceful protests ended communist rule in Czechoslovakia, bringing Vaclav Havel to power.

name: romanian-revolution
description: Violent uprising overthrew and executed dictator Nicolae Ceausescu, ending communist rule in Romania.

name: iraq-invades-kuwait
description: Saddam Hussein's forces invaded Kuwait, leading to international coalition and the Gulf War.

name: namibia-independence
description: Namibia gained independence from South Africa after decades of armed struggle and UN involvement.

name: anc-unbanned
description: South African government lifted ban on ANC and released Nelson Mandela, beginning end of apartheid.

name: operation-desert-storm
description: US-led coalition launched air and ground campaign that liberated Kuwait from Iraqi occupation.

name: slovenia-croatia-independence
description: Slovenia and Croatia declared independence from Yugoslavia, beginning the country's violent dissolution.

name: eritrea-independence
description: Eritrea gained independence from Ethiopia after 30 years of armed struggle.

name: european-union-created
description: Maastricht Treaty transformed the European Community into the European Union with expanded powers.

name: anc-wins-election
description: Nelson Mandela and the ANC won South Africa's first democratic election, ending apartheid rule.

name: amazon-founded
description: Jeff Bezos founded Amazon as an online bookstore that would become the world's largest retailer.

name: wto-created
description: World Trade Organization was established to regulate international trade and settle disputes.

name: taliban-takes-kabul
description: Taliban captured Kabul and established the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan under strict sharia law.

name: welfare-reform-act
description: Clinton signed law that ended federal welfare guarantee and imposed work requirements on recipients.

name: blair-becomes-pm
description: Tony Blair's Labour Party won a landslide victory, ending 18 years of Conservative government in Britain.

name: monica-lewinsky-scandal
description: Clinton's affair with White House intern led to his impeachment by the House for perjury.

name: nato-kosovo-campaign
description: NATO bombed Serbia for 78 days to stop ethnic cleansing of Albanians in Kosovo.

name: east-timor-independence-vote
description: East Timor voted for independence from Indonesia, leading to violence and UN intervention.

name: putin-becomes-president
description: Vladimir Putin was elected Russian President after serving as acting president, beginning his long rule.

name: wikipedia-launched
description: Jimmy Wales launched Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit.

name: us-china-spy-plane-incident
description: US spy plane collided with Chinese fighter jet and made emergency landing, creating diplomatic crisis.

name: enron-scandal
description: Energy company Enron collapsed in massive accounting fraud, costing investors billions.

name: euro-coins-circulation
description: Euro banknotes and coins replaced national currencies in 12 European countries.

name: eu-expansion-25
description: European Union admitted 10 new members, mostly from Eastern Europe, in its largest expansion.

name: orange-revolution
description: Mass protests in Ukraine overturned fraudulent election and brought pro-Western government to power.

name: angela-merkel-elected
description: Angela Merkel became Germany's first female Chancellor, leading Europe's largest economy for 16 years.

name: montenegro-independence
description: Montenegro voted for independence from Serbia, completing Yugoslavia's dissolution.

name: virginia-tech-shooting
description: Gunman killed 32 people at Virginia Tech in the deadliest school shooting in US history.

name: burma-saffron-revolution
description: Buddhist monks led mass protests against Myanmar's military junta, which violently suppressed them.

name: kosovo-independence
description: Kosovo declared independence from Serbia, recognized by many Western nations but disputed by Russia.

name: obama-inaugurated
description: Barack Obama became the first African American President of the United States.

name: wikileaks-cables
description: WikiLeaks released thousands of classified US diplomatic cables, embarrassing governments worldwide.

name: chilean-mine-rescue
description: All 33 miners trapped underground for 69 days were rescued in a dramatic televised operation.

name: egyptian-revolution-2011
description: Mass protests in Tahrir Square forced President Mubarak to resign after 30 years in power.

name: sandy-hook-shooting
description: Gunman killed 26 people, including 20 children, at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Connecticut.

name: snowden-revelations
description: NSA contractor Edward Snowden leaked classified documents revealing massive government surveillance programs.

name: scottish-independence-vote
description: Scotland voted 55% to 45% to remain part of the United Kingdom in independence referendum.

name: refugee-crisis-peak
description: Over one million refugees and migrants reached Europe, primarily fleeing Syria, creating humanitarian crisis.

name: pulse-nightclub-shooting
description: Gunman killed 49 people at gay nightclub in Orlando in deadliest US attack since 9/11.

name: trump-inauguration
description: Donald Trump was inaugurated as the 45th President after his unexpected electoral victory.

name: las-vegas-shooting
description: Gunman killed 60 people at outdoor concert from hotel room in deadliest mass shooting in US history.

name: charlottesville-rally
description: White supremacist rally in Virginia turned deadly when a car plowed into counter-protesters.

name: us-north-korea-summit
description: Trump and Kim Jong Un held historic first meeting between US and North Korean leaders in Singapore.

name: yellow-vest-protests
description: French protests against fuel taxes and economic inequality spread nationwide, forcing government concessions.

name: boris-johnson-becomes-pm
description: Boris Johnson became Prime Minister pledging to deliver Brexit after Theresa May's resignation.

name: greta-thunberg-un-speech
description: Teenage climate activist addressed the UN, accusing world leaders of stealing her future with inaction.

name: george-floyd-protests
description: Floyd's death sparked worldwide protests against police brutality and racial injustice.

name: biden-elected
description: Joe Biden defeated Donald Trump to become the 46th President of the United States.

name: us-withdrawal-afghanistan
description: US completed chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan after 20 years of war, with Taliban rapidly taking control.

name: cop26-glasgow
description: UN climate conference in Glasgow produced agreements on coal, methane, and deforestation.

name: taliban-return-to-power
description: Taliban seized Kabul as US withdrew, restoring Islamic Emirate twenty years after its overthrow.

name: iran-protests-2022
description: Death of Mahsa Amini in morality police custody sparked nationwide protests against the Islamic Republic.

name: pelosi-taiwan-visit
description: House Speaker Pelosi's visit to Taiwan provoked Chinese military exercises and heightened tensions.

name: ai-rapid-advancement-gpt4
description: OpenAI released GPT-4, sparking global debate about AI capabilities, safety, and regulation.
